tool_description: A unified, headless API for any product on the internet.
name: Violet
title: Violet

api_list.name: /apps/{app_id}/webhooks
api_list.description:
Creates a new webhook for the desired event. The remote endpoint must be HTTPS.

We currently limit webhooks to one per event per app. If the event is already active on a previously created webhook that existing webhook will be updated with the new endpoint.

remote_endpoint.description: Remote endpoint the webhook posts against.

api_list.name: /checkout/cart/{cart_id}/submit
api_list.description: Submits a cart. For each unique bag in your cart an order will be submitted to the source merchant's platform. Depending on the number of bags in your cart this request can take a few moments as each external order is submitted.

app_id.description: ID of the App creating the order

merchant_id.description: ID of the Merchant the Bag references

order_id.description: ID of the Order the Bag belongs to

shipping_method.description: Shipping Methods belonging to an Order

bag_id.description: ID of the Bag the Shipping Method applies to

api_list.name: /orders/search
api_list.description:
Performs a paginated search of all orders. Orders can be searched by 'merchant_id', 'user_id', or a combination of both.

Orders are limited to those placed by your app.

api_list.name: /login
api_list.description: Log into an existing Violet account with a username and password. If sucessful an access token will be returned in the response body for use in additional requests against the API.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://violet.p.rapidapi.com/login"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "violet.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://violet.p.rapidapi.com/login"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "violet.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

merchant_id.description: The Id of the Store the User is associated to.

token.description: Users Access Token. Currently expires after 1440 minutes.

type.description: The allowed values for the user type

verified.description: If a user has verified their emailed address

api_list.name: /catalog/products/search
api_list.description: Search the complete product catalog by using the available filters in the request body.

optional_parameters.name: exclude_public
optional_parameters.description: Excludes all publicly available products that are not part of your curated catalog. In sandbox this should be left as false as there are no merchant <-> developer relationships and all products are publically available to all developers.

default_image_url.description: The default/cover image of the Product

gtins.description: List of Global Trade Item Numbers

max_commission_rate.description: The maximum commission rate offered by a merchant.

external_id.description: External ID
External ID

max_price.description: Maximum Price the Product sells for

merchant_id.description: Merchant ID

meta.description: Additional Meta Data of the Offer

min_price.description: Minimum Price the Product sells for

external_id.description: External ID

currency.description: The starting currency of this SKU

external_id.description: ID of the SKU on the External Ecom Platform

merchant_id.description: ID of the Merchant

sku_id.description: ID of SKU Dimensions Belong To

tax_type.description: Type of Tax on this SKU

variant_values.description: Variant Values that apply to this SKU

items.description: Individual Variation Value for a Sku

special_commission_rate.description: If the commission rate is unique to this offer.

external_id.description: ID of the Variant on the External Ecommerce Platform
ID of the Variant in the External Ecommerce Platform

product_variant_value_id.description: ID of the Product Variation Value

sku_ids.description: ID's of SKU's containing this Variant Value

api_list.name: /checkout/cart
api_list.description:
Creates a new empty cart.

By setting the 'apply_current_user' flag to true the user associated with the current access token will be applied to the cart. If the user has an existing shipping address and/or billing address saved to their account these will automatically be applied to the cart. Only applies to oAuthed customer transactions.

By setting the 'default_payment_method' flag to true the default payment method, if one exists, of the user associated with the current token will be applied to the cart. Only applies to oAuthed customer transactions.

Use the optional 'app_order_id' parameter to map the newly created cart to an ID in your systems.

api_list.name: /checkout/cart/{cart_id}/customer
api_list.description: Applies a guest customer to the cart. Guest customers consist of a first name, last name, and email address. Guest customers are not persisted within Violet for use on future orders.
